content: Navigation system works on the concept of linked list.
title: Single Linked List

content: introduction: Single linked list is a linear data structure. It’s elements are not stored in contiguous memory location like arrays. it is slightly different from array. it made by the nodes, each nodes consist a data and the address of the next node and each nodes are linked using pointers.
title: Single Linked List

content: creation of node To create a new node in C++, you will need to define a structure or class that represents a node, and then create an instance of that structure or class. Here is an example of a node structure in C++: struct Node { int value; Node* next; };
title: Single Linked List

content: insertion
title: Single Linked List
Single Linked List
Single Linked List

content: insertion at any position // insertion at any position void insertAtPos(int pos, int value) { struct Node *newnode; newnode = (struct Node *)malloc(sizeof(struct Node)); newnode->data = value; struct Node *temp = NULL; int i = 1; temp = head; while (i < pos - 1) { temp = temp->next; i++; } newnode->next = temp->next; temp->next = newnode; }
title: Single Linked List

content: Deletion
title: Single Linked List

content: deletion from begining // deletion at begining void deletatBeg() { struct Node *temp; temp = head; head = head->next; free(temp); }
title: Single Linked List

content: deletion from end // deletion at end void deletatEnd() { struct Node *temp, *prev; prev = temp = head; while (temp->next != NULL) { prev = temp; temp = temp->next; } prev->next = NULL; free(temp); }
title: Single Linked List

content: deletion from any position // deletion at any position void deletatPos(int pos) { struct Node *nextnode, *temp; int i = 1; nextnode = temp = head; while (i < pos) { temp = nextnode; nextnode = nextnode->next; i++; } temp->next = nextnode->next; free(nextnode); }
title: Single Linked List

content: Sorting of the singly linked list // sorting of linked list void sortlist() { struct Node *ptr, *cpt; ptr = head; int temp; while (ptr->next != NULL) { cpt = ptr->next; while (cpt != NULL) { if (ptr->data > cpt->data) { temp = ptr->data; ptr->data = cpt->data; cpt->data = temp; } cpt = cpt->next; } ptr = ptr->next; } }
title: Single Linked List

content: Print function // printing of linked list void print() { struct Node *temp; temp = head; while (temp != NULL) { printf("%d-->", temp->data); temp = temp->next; } printf("NULL"); }
title: Single Linked List

content: to find length // length of the linked int getlength() { int len = 0; struct Node *temp = head; while (temp != NULL) { len++; temp = temp->next; } printf("%d", len); }
title: Single Linked List
